definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki- moon has also extended his condolences.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文也对巴西火灾遇难者表示哀悼。

sentences.english: The remaining victim, Boote, was also from the Royal Military police.
sentences.chinese: 另一名遇难者布特也来自皇家宪兵队。

sentences.english: He is ordering flags at all government buildings to be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他已下令所有政府大楼降半旗悼念遇难者。

sentences.english: Unclaimed bodies of the victims, such as rehabilitation work is under way.
sentences.chinese: 遇难者遗体认领等善后工作也正在展开。

sentences.english: Memorial to the victims of genocide.
sentences.chinese: 种族大屠杀遇难者纪念碑。

sentences.english: Among the dead was Laith Misha'an, the leader of the local pro-government Sunni militia.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名遇难者为当地支持政府派逊尼派义勇军领袖。

sentences.english: Many families of the victims also holding a sign hanging family photos.
sentences.chinese: 很多遇难者家属还举着挂有亲人照片的牌子。

sentences.english: Many victims' family members object to Arad's plan to list the names randomly.
sentences.chinese: 许多遇难者家属反对阿拉德随意排列死者姓名的方案。

sentences.english: DNA of Germanywing victims may be confirmed this week.
sentences.chinese: 德翼坠机遇难者DNA确认或本周内完成。

sentences.english: Reports suggested a 14-year-old boy was among those killed.
sentences.chinese: 有报道称，遇难者中包括一名14岁的男孩。

sentences.english: A security guard watches as a relative of a fire victim breaks down.
sentences.chinese: 一位遇难者的亲属失声痛哭，一名保安在一边观看。

sentences.english: A minute of silence was observed for the quake victims before the run.
sentences.chinese: 起跑前，全体与会者向汶川大地震遇难者默哀一分钟。

sentences.english: The casualties included a young Israeli-American rabbi and his wife.
sentences.chinese: 遇难者包括一名以色列裔美国犹太教士和他的妻子。

sentences.english: He put the rock up for sale on an a auction site to raise money for earthquake victims.
sentences.chinese: 他把这颗巨石放上拍卖网以为地震遇难者募款。

sentences.english: At least a dozen of the victims were local journalists.
sentences.chinese: 至少有十二名遇难者是当地的新闻记者。

sentences.english: At the edge of the little town, banners say Wufu is in ' deep mourning.
sentences.chinese: 五福镇的边缘地区挂著“深切哀悼”遇难者的标语。

definition: victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
